My debugging habits are usually something like this:

1. Read the error message (if there is one)
2. Think
3. Read the log
4. Think
5. Write a unit test
6. Launch the debugger

Since adopting junit (2 -3 years ago) I can honestly say I've not yet been
forced down to level 6! I try to encourage programmers in my team not to
start at 6 first.

Judging by the varied responses there's clearly a whole range of other
successful strategies - maybe it's related to the type of application being
programmed.

Steven
subject: Re: [junit] debuggers
